DataElement.preferredName: Blood Tissue Specimen Other Diseases and Disorders Future Research Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to consent for the future use of a blood or tissue specimen for research on other abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Tissue Specimen Other Diseases and Disorders Future Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to consent for the future use of a blood or tissue specimen for research on other abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Other Diseases and Disorders Future Research Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:A time that is yet to come.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A time that is yet to come.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has consented to stor
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has consented to storage of samples for future studies on other diseases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her blood to be kept for use in future research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient give consent to provide a blood for future research purposes

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree to have excess specimens from this study stored for future AIDS-related research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient give consent to provide blood for the PRIMeR ancillary study and for future research purposes

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to extra and leftover samples that may be banked and used for future cancer research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6702
ReferenceDocuments.description: Previously collected specimens can be used for research about other diseases.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient consented to samples and related information being kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has consented to blood and tissue samples being banked for future research

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to the blood sample and related information be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have tumor tissue samples and related information sent to NRG Oncology and kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient consented to tissue samples and related information collected and stored in a Biobank for use in future health research related to the purposes of this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to allow tumor tissue samples and related information to be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have tissue samples and related health information kept in a biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having blood banked  for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example:  diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: SWOG-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: My tissue and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having blood collected and banked  for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example:  diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have tissue and blood samples and related health information kept in a biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree that their samples and related health information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future unknown studies beyond that of preventing, predicting, or treating colorectal cancer and its precursors?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Patient Consent Ind-2 2018303v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
